metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11481 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Kevin Backhouse discovered that apport would read a user-supplied configuration file with elevated privileges. By replacing the file with a symbolic link, a user could get apport to read any file on the system as root, with unknown consequences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11481` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
apport-gtk - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
apport-kde - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
apport-noui - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
apport-retrace - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
apport-valgrind - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
dh-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
python-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
python-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
python3-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
python3-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Kevin Backhouse of Semmle Security Research Team

criterions.comment: apport package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8').
